name: Hudson River Online Trivia | New York | 5 Questions

questions.text: Robert Fulton's steamboat traveled from New York City to Albany on the Hudson River.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The trip was made by the Clermont on August 18, 1807 and made the 150 mile trip in 32 hours.

questions.text: Approximately how long is the Hudson River in miles?
In what year did the last tourist steamboat run on the Hudson River?
questions.explanation:
1971.

	The trips were run between New York City and Albany. At one time there was a dayline cruise that stopped between the two cities, left daytrippers off for lunch and had them picked up from a boat going in the opposite direction.

questions.text: From what lake in the Adirondacks does the Hudson River start?
questions.explanation:
Lake Tear in the Clouds.

	The largest headstream is the Opalescent River which flows out of Lake Tear of the Clouds.

questions.text: 'The Legend of Sleepy Hollow' and 'Rip Van Winkle' were two novels based on folklore of the Hudson River region. Who was the author?
questions.explanation:
Washington Irving.

	He was born in New York City in 1783 and proved the effectiveness of the short story.
